definitions.definition: give (someone) something, typically money, in recognition of loss, suffering, or injury incurred; recompense.
examples: payments were made to farmers to compensate them for cuts in subsidies
synonyms: indemnify "we agreed to compensate him for his loss"

examples: he will be richly compensated for his efforts

definitions.definition: make up for (something unwelcome or unpleasant) by exerting an opposite force or effect.
examples: officials have boosted levies to compensate for huge deficits

definitions.definition: act to neutralize or correct (a deficiency or abnormality in a physical property or effect).
examples: the output voltage rises, compensating for the original fall
synonyms: negative "his flair compensated for his faults"

definitions.definition: attempt to conceal or offset (a disability or frustration) by development in another direction.
examples: they identified with radical movements to compensate for their inability to relate to individual human beings
synonyms: rectify "you must compensate for what you did"

definitions.definition: provide (a pendulum) with extra or less weight to neutralize the effects of temperature, etc.
